titles.title: To redesignate the Big South Trail in the Comanche Peak Wilderness Area of Roosevelt National Forest in Colorado as the "Jaryd Atadero Legacy Trail".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Referred to Department of Agriculture for comments.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-738.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 419.

action.text: Mr. Tancredo moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3817.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 7/25/2000--Passed House amended. Dedicates the Big South Trail in the Comanche Peak Wilderness Area of Roosevelt National Forest, Colorado, to Jaryd Atadero and his legacy of promoting safe outdoor recreation for children.Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to post a sign at the Trail's trailhead recognizing the loss of Jaryd Atadero and the need for increased awareness of child safety in outdoor recreation settings.
